recipe_name: Creamy White Bean Soup With Spicy Paprika Oil
suggestions:
- Soak and cook 12 oz of dried beans instead of using canned beans
- Use 4 cups of stock instead of 6 for a thicker consistency
- Use oat milk instead of dairy for the soup
- Add Aleppo pepper flakes for a deep red color
- Consider adding saffron to the oil for enhanced flavor and color

- Use Italian dressing instead of water for added flavor
- Add garlic powder, lemon juice, bay leaf, and thyme for enhanced taste
- Use lime juice to reduce fish odor in the microwave
- Brush the bottom of the dish with olive oil and add white vermouth for extra flavor
- Use an insta-read thermometer to prevent overcooking

- Use parchment paper for crisping
- Preheat baking sheets for crisping
- Soak sweet potatoes in water beforehand
- Bake on a rack on top of a baking sheet
- Cut sweet potatoes uniformly

- Brown the chicken and then remove from the pan before making the sauce
- Pour off excess oil and saut√© shallot, garlic, and thyme leaves before adding liquid and lemon zest
- Add butter after reducing the liquid to emulsify and thicken the sauce
- Use lemon zest, which is the yellow part of a lemon's skin, not the white pith
- Consider cutting the chicken breast longways in half

recipe_name: Black Pepper Beef and Cabbage Stir-Fry
suggestions:
- Add more cabbage
- Double the spice mix
- Add chicken stock thickened with cornstarch for sauce
- Put beef in the freezer for easier slicing
- Consider adding sliced red onions for more flavor

- Use a slightly lower temperature and longer roasting time
- Add bits of garlic and dried basil to the oil
- Roast skin side up for easier skin removal
- Use a pastry brush to oil the foil and rack for easier cleanup
- Add garlic halfway through cooking time

- Use less mustard if preferred
- Marinate beef in red wine with herbs and orange zest
- Substitute bacon for salt pork
- Cook carrots for a full hour
- Use rendered duck fat or extra butter/oil if not using pork
